Key Arguments: The legislation is a slippery slope to totalitarianism.
It stifles criticism of the government and its supporters.
The government determining truth and being exempt from the legislation is problematic.
The legislation could be used to eliminate criticism and censor threats to government power.
Past experiences with fact-checkers show that truth can be manipulated.
Massive fines and jail time could worsen the situation.
Stifling debate and discussion hinders progress, free thought, and democracy.
Notable Quotes: This is a slippery slope to totalitarianism.
Who or what gets to define what is ‘true’?
Real science and progress welcomes questions and criticisms because that is how it becomes stronger.
